metadata.synopsis: Dialog for Harvard, a comedian that dares you to beat him in a 'comedy battle'. Comedian is standing on a stage when player clicks on him. Turns to player to speak to him, then turns back to face the crowd to perform.

13.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
13.text: What do you think? Want to pit your wits in the Laff Riot?
13.context: NodeContext: eager, wants a bit of a comedy competition to get the crowd going (he is also convinced he's going to win)

21.speaker: Player
21.text: I'll bite: what's this Laff Riot?
21.context: NodeContext: emphasis on boffo yocks - the creme de la creme of jokes. Eager, over the top.

31.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
31.text: It's all about the boffo yocks. We see who can tell the funniest stories, and the winner gets the prize!
31.context: NodeContext: emphasis on boffo yocks - the creme de la creme of jokes. Eager, over the top.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: All right, you're on. It's got to be better than killing rats.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Suits me - I'm pretty good at riots. I'm in.
49.context: NodeContext: eager, confident - sure he's going to smash this

15.speaker: Player
15.text: I'm a bard, Willoughby. Prepare to get served.
15.context: NodeContext: eager, confident - sure he's going to smash this

58.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
58.text: Grrrreat! I'll go first to show you how it's done, and then you see if you can top me.
58.context: NodeContext: eager, confident - sure he's going to smash this

26.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
26.text: Hel-LO, Baldurians! You know, I wouldn't be here tonight, except my wife ran off with a cambion. That's right, I got fiend-zoned.
26.context: NodeContext: player can have approached from the right or left, so maybe having the comedian square his shoulders, smile and put on his 'performance' facade. He's greeting the crowd, full confident he's gonna smash it. He's a bit of sleaze bag.

5.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
5.text: We used to have a drow comedian. I had to ask her to stop casting Tasha's Hideous Laughter on the audience.
5.context: NodeContext: Sleazy show biz comedian, pleased with himself and certain you're pleased with him too

10.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
10.text: Then I asked her how many drow it takes to light a torch, and she said, 'None, we have darkvision.'
10.context: NodeContext: Sleazy show biz entertainer, pleased with himself and certain you're pleased with him too

36.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
36.context: NodeContext: the big punchline to one of his jokes, cheeky sleazy grin

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *The Elfsong patrons think that one's funny. There may be hope for you yet.*
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: Comedian steps to one side, and then the player stands up on the stage.NodeContext: turn to player (could be on right or left), still in cheeky comedian mode (last one is delivered like a punchline). Steps to the side so the player can step on the stage

29.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
29.text: Your turn, Smart Stuff. Knock 'em dead! ...But not literally, got me?
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Comedian steps to one side, and then the player stands up on the stage.NodeContext: turn to player (could be on right or left), still in cheeky comedian mode (last one is delivered like a punchline). Steps to the side so the player can step on the stage

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Willoughby the comedian, folks! Were his jokes good, or did he just smell funny?

6.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
6.text: Argh! Got me with an ancient jest that's older than I am.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: Say, what's the difference between a dwarf and a bulette? You can't toss the bulette!

24.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
24.text: You know why I hate vampires? They just suck.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: You know why I hate vampires? They just suck.

42.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
42.text: I first heard that one when I was in short pants on the school playground.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: I tried sleeping with a dragonborn the other night, but it didn't work out - he had a reptile dysfunction.

22.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
22.text: Win or lose, I'm stealing that one.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I asked a zombie reanimator out on a date, but she said she wasn't interested in nec-romance.

57.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
57.text: Didn't I tell this joke already?

14.speaker: Player
14.text: What does you call a room full of people who don't applaud? Dead.
14.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

60.text: Whoa, hang on - this should be against the rules.
60.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

2.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
2.text: Whoa, hang on - this should be against the rules.
2.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

0.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
0.text: The Dead Three, am I right? What losers. You know why Bane worshippers will never conquer the world? They don't have the Bhaals!
0.context: NodeContext: wincing a little, knows it's a no go area for people

4.speaker: Player
4.text: The Dead Three, am I right? What losers. You know why Bane worshippers will never conquer the world? They don't have the Bhaals!
4.context: NodeContext: wincing a little, knows it's a no go area for people

7.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
7.text: Don't joke about religion, Smart Stuff.
7.context: NodeContext: a bit of a wince, knows it's always dodgy to joke about these things

54.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
54.text: *Cheers, whistles, and applause. You're almost shocked.*

34.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
34.text: *Cheers, whistles, and applause. You're almost shocked.*

8.speaker: Narrator
8.text: *Cheers, whistles, and applause. You're almost shocked.*
8.context: CinematicNodeContext: No need to show the people, only the sound

12.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
12.text: Yeah, yeah, you're hilarious. Now get out of here before I lose my job.

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *A single person applauds from the back of the room - probably out of pity.*
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: No need to show the people, only the sounds

37.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
37.text: Sorry, Smart Stuff. No joy for you, I'm afraid, but that sounds like job security for me.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: A mind flayer's duergar slave lost his nose, so I asked the illithid, 'How does he smell?' and it said, 'I have eaten its brain.'
18.context: NodeContext: grimacing, player delivered a terrible joke

28.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
28.context: NodeContext: grimacing, player delivered a terrible joke

19.speaker: Player
19.text: Our cleric tried to cast Healing Word on a ham, but it was already cured.

47.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
47.text: Pig jokes are never wrong. Well done.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: CLAP, OR I'LL RIP OUT YOUR SPINES.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Hey! I asked my wizard to cast Shatter. He said, 'Shatter? I hardly know 'er!'
56.context: NodeContext: secretly pleased the player is bombng

61.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
61.text: If that's the best you've got, Smart Stuff, you should quit before the crowd gets angry.
61.context: NodeContext: secretly pleased the player is bombng

33.speaker: Player
33.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: An interesting technique, but all right.
41.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

52.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
52.text: An interesting technique, but all right.
52.context: NodeContext: Unsure (player has threatened crowd to get a laugh)

20.text: *A single person applauds frantically from the back.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *A single person applauds frantically from the back.*

16.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
16.text: Sorry, Smart Stuff - threats ain't comedy, no matter how brawny you are. But thanks for the job security.

23.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
23.text: Second best? Me? Maybe it's time for this old boy to find a new grift.

32.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
32.text: Hey, Smart Stuff, I'm Willoughby the comedian, and we got a little contest here called the Laff Riot. You want to play along?

35.speaker: Harvard Willoughby
35.text: Another triumph! Yes indeedy, I'm still the comedy king!
